hook.text: A Jehovah's Witness is bleeding to death but refuses a blood transfusion. The doctor can save her easily.

buildup.text: Beneficence says doctors should do what's best for the patient. Autonomy says patients decide for themselves.

discovery.text: These two principles collide when a patient's choice leads to harm the doctor could prevent.

twist.text: Overriding a patient's wish 'for their own good' has a name: paternalism. Medicine did it for centuries.

climax.text: Modern ethics mostly sides with autonomy. Your right to refuse treatment trumps a doctor's urge to save you.
